meanings.definition: The quality of being convenient or practical.
meanings.sent1: Her expediences in organizing events made everything run smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The expediences of having a map while traveling are undeniable.
meanings.sent3: Carrying a mini sewing kit proved to be an expedience when her button popped off.
meanings.sent4: In the world of cooking, having pre-chopped ingredients is an expedience akin to having a sous chef.
meanings.sent5: The expediences of using a smartphone for navigation are evident in how quickly you can find your way around.

meanings.definition: The act of achieving a particular goal quickly and efficiently.
meanings.sent1: His expediences in completing projects before the deadline were commendable.
meanings.sent2: The team's expediences in winning the championship were a result of their hard work.
meanings.sent3: Racing against the clock, she managed to finish the puzzle with great expedience.
meanings.sent4: The athlete's expediences on the track were like watching poetry in motion.
meanings.sent5: The expediences of a well-planned strategy became evident when they won the game effortlessly.
